climbs.name: View to a Thrill
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Jim Hammerle, December 1995

content.description: Step off the slab and onto the featured arete, working your way back and forth slightly to find the easiest line. At the top the angle kicks back a little and some delicate holds demand some care as you make the last moves to the anchor. Great rock and positioning on this one.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor/rap (shared w/ Casino Royale)
content.location: Located on the right side of the formation and starting from the right (downhill) side of a huge fallen block which forms a sloping slab.

content.description: Fun climbing up the featured face between the other routes - worth doing if the rope is hanging over it.
content.location:
Located on the face between

Casino Royale

and

View to a Thrill

.

content.description: Start off a boulder and onto the rounded arete passing three bolts along the way as you balance your way to the top, cutting right to a bolted anchor shared with Goldfinger.
content.location:
Located on the far left arete of the formation and just left of

Goldfinger

, a striking thin crack in a corner.

content.description: Start up lower-angled rock past some hollow gear placements and then into a great finger crack that steepens to vertical. The climbing is surprisingly strenuous for the length of the route, but the gear is good despite the left wall being somewhat slick and lacking in friction. At the top of the climb traverse left to a bolted anchor shared with Octopussy.
content.protection: Gear to 2 inches, 2 bolt anchor/rap (shared w/Octopussy)
content.location:
Located on the left side of the rock in a prominent left-facing corner with whitish colored rock on the left wall, and just right of

Octopussy

.

climbs.name: Casino Royale
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Jim Hammerle, December 1995

content.description:
Located on the right side of the formation and starting from the left (uphill) side of a huge fallen block which forms a sloping slab.

Face climb past a bolt into a seam which opens up to a thin crack with face holds higher. Work up and slightly right to finish at shared anchors with

View to a Thrill

, the route to the right.
content.protection: bolt, gear to 1", 2 bolt anchor/rap (shared w/ View To A Thrill)
